intro: Centella glochidiata, commonly known as the burr centella, is a perennial herb native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, sometimes spiny stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers followed by small, round fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest in both botanical research and traditional medicine.
